title: Is aurelion not suppose to be able to reactive his Q?
body:
Like double tap to stun the same way annivia can do it?

Atm it seems that it's impossible to reactivate in for like .25 seconds or so, is this a bug or intended and just not explained in ability tooltip?

replies.body: Aurelion Sol's Q has a bit of a reactivation delay on it because we don't want it to be too effective against champions who've managed to get on top of him. He's got his ult as a occasional reliable peel option, overall though vulnerability to people in his face is an intended weakness - positioning's one of the primary skills he tests.

In the champion spotlight, it says that Aurelion Sol has two countermeasures to someone jumping on him, his Ult (which we don't unlock 'till level 6) and a point blank Q (which is false if you're saying that this is working as intended).
The Q's a counter measure that can stop them getting onto you certainly, not to stop them once they're already on you.

His Ult is the only thing that can save him and they are nerfing that.

I dont know where they are getting these numbers but Im thinking in 5 man premades where ASol can group fight because that is all he can do.

There should be some form of indication on the Q icon during the brief window you're unable to recast, yeah. At present we can either show time until recast or allow you to buffer a command for a spell, not both. I'll hit up one of our engineers, see what would be involved in improving that.

As far as mention on the tooltip goes there's a lot of stuff we don't mention on tooltips because it's not relevant to the primary tooltip user, which is someone playing the champion for the first time or two. We've seen a pretty consistent pattern where putting small information the player doesn't immediately need to know into tooltips reduces people's ability to learn a champion because it draws attention away from the key points. As a result there are a number of things we choose not to mention there, especially if the things in question will either be naturally learned, are better observed than stated, or aren't particularly relevant unless theorycrafting (in which case outside of game sources are a good alternative).

I had no idea that there was a delay before being able to recast his Q until seeing this post and I've played a few games with him. I realize now that this has caused some really awkward moments that I attributed to something else like not hitting Q again fast enough, trying to cast two abilities at the same time, or other bad play on my part. Turns out there is a piece of arcane knowledge about this ability that is not otherwise documented. Its really hard to get better at a champ when important information like recast delay isn't clearly communicated.

Frankly, the tooltip for the ability screams "double tap me for an instant stun effect just like Anivia's Q" which isn't true. Adding "after a brief delay the ability can be reactivated" to the tooltip seems to be a small cost in exchange for clearly communicating the intent of the ability. Many abilities that can be reactivated allow the player to 'double tap' the ability for an instant effect. 

I've already mentioned Anivia in regard to 'double tapping' but Varus, Xerath, Lux, and Gragas all have 'double tap' abilities. The last two have even had special announcements in patch notes when the 'double tap' was implemented on their respective abilities. In contrast you have the (previously mentioned) Zed ult that specifically states its delay before recasting. I bring up all these champions to illustrate that A-Sol's Q deviates from the norm as far as delays are concerned. Even Lux and Ezreal ult's clearly state that there is a delay before the effect even though the delay on both abilities is more than obvious after a single observation of them in-game.

Please don't tread down this path of non-clarity again. Players pleaded with Riot when Diana was released to put a passive counter in the form of a buff on her. These pleas were swiftly rebuked by the lead on Diana because they were certain that watching Diana swing her weapon was clarity enough in the heat of battle. Just as you now (appear) to argue that A-Sol's current Q tooltip is clarity enough in the heat of battle. IIRC it was over a year before the players were heard on Diana's passive buff counter. 

Please listen now and clarify the intent of A-Sol's Q in the tooltip. A single sentence to clarify the recast delay wouldn't add much to a medium size tooltip like Starsurge's. There is still plenty of room before you reach half the size of something extreme like Illaoi's E tooltip.

I completely agree and understand why some aspects of some abilities would be unneeded and actually impede in the learning of the champion. 

At first i wasn't actually sure if this was a bug, intended, or me just not noticing a stun/silence somehow (which would be really hard considering i'd lose my passive).  It completely lacks clarity. 

I agree that it would be unnecessary to add to the ability tooltip, but only in the case that the actual spell indicator didn't show the proper effective zone of the skill. 

{{champion:154}} E doesn't state that it's range increases as it's charged, but it's shown to increase range by the highlighted area. This doesn't leave the player to question why they couldn't jump at the maximum range.

{{champion:101}} Q, both shows it's range increasing and states that it increases as it charges with the channel.

{{champion:104}} Q indicator, shows very clearly which area will not be affected by the ability. 

{{champion:238}}  ult doesn't have any type of ability indicator, so it must be explicitly stated in the tooltip.

So i guess what i'm asking is, could you please change the spell indicator, as to not highlight the area before it can be detonated, even if it doesn't say it can't be reactivated for .5 seconds.

but the fact that you Can't reactive your Q right on top of you has always annoyed me. 
if you stun/blind/anything Sol his orbs go away and you can easily get inside them before they come back up. at that point you can't do anything to save yourself (other than flash or R) since your Q is useless once they are already inside.

another thing I don't like is if you have your W active, if you get stunned, your W goes back to normal with the cooldown before reactiving it. 
it should go straight back to W I would think. just my opinion anyway

in other words, his weaknesses are insanely weak

>vulnerability to people in his face is an intended weakness

It is a shitty weakness to have in league of mobility

He is also extremely vulnerable to cc on top of that because it shuts his dps down and it allows people to get in his face after which he cant do anything.

I really think Sol needs to be able to detonate the q immediately otherwise he is too vulnerable

Lets take lucian for example as an adc you want to kite because your weakness is people in your face. But when they do manage to get in your face at least you can still fight back with strong auto's
Aurelion sol does not have this ability at all he needs to stay at a very very specific distance from his opponents and at this distance he is always within gapclose range or retaliation range.

Lucian while also not willing to fight in melee range has a super spammable dash at no cost to get out. On top of that he can build an anti cc item which gives lifesteal.

As a mage Aurelion sol does not have sustain to heal back during a fight if he manages somehow to disengage a bit.

He severely lacks option for defense only thing he can actually use is the ultimate, zhonyas does not really help as it stops you from positioning allowing opponents to get into your face very easy 
And spellvamp also sucks on him as everything he has is aoe therefore only 5% applies.

3 things i would possibly change on Aurelion sol would be to

1. Let him double tap the Q for a quick stun, a more easy way to balance this is to make the stun time grow, so double tapping might only stun for like half a second
2. And make his orbiting starts count as single target spells so he can acces spellvamp.
3. His escape velocity, right now it immediatly drops to 0 if you get hit or make to sharp a turn, what if instead it would rapidly decrease but not fully back to 0 so rather then instantly halting you it would decrease over a half second or so by 40% this would give a better chance to get away from your opponents and they can still fully stop the velocity by damaging 3 times.
